intro: Trichocline speciosa, commonly known as the showy trichocline, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its striking, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Trichocline speciosa is valued for its ornamental beauty and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
